revised_title: Anatomy of Tridacna: A Study on the Internal Structure and Function
tldr: The author, John Denis Macdonald, examines the internal structure and function of Tridacna, a type of bivalve mollusk. He describes various features, such as the mantle, branchiae, and alimentary canal, and discusses the possible functions of a large, fatty-secreting organ. The study is accompanied by illustrations of the animal and its internal organs.
